item.title: EU universal charger rules come into force - The Hindu
item.description:
EU Universal Charger Rules Take Effect

Date: December 28, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The European Union's new regulations mandating a common charger for all smartphones, tablets, and cameras have come into force, a move aimed at reducing costs and electronic waste.

  • All new devices sold in the EU must now feature a USB-C charging port.
  • This change is expected to simplify life for consumers and cut down on the number of obsolete chargers.
  • The law was initially approved in 2022 and gives laptop manufacturers until early 2026 to comply.
  • Apple, initially resistant, has started adopting the new charging standard.
"It's time for THE charger," the European Commission stated, emphasizing the benefits of reduced e-waste.

This significant step by the EU seeks to encourage consistency across the tech industry, benefiting consumers while addressing environmental concerns.

item.title: Vijay Sales' Apple Days Sale: Big discounts on iPhone 16 Pro Max, MacBook Pro Series and more | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Vijay Sales’ Apple Days Sale: Big discounts on iPhone 16 Pro Max, MacBook Pro Series and more

Date: 29 December 2024 - 5 January 2025

Source: Live Mint

The year-end shopping season brings significant discounts on a variety of Apple products during Vijay Sales’ Apple Days Sale, including iPhones, MacBooks, iPads, and more.

  • iPhone 16 Pro available for ₹106,900, discounted from ₹119,900.
  • iPhone 16 Pro Max 256GB priced at ₹130,650, with an effective offer price of ₹127,650.
  • iPhone 15 128GB available for ₹60,490, further reduced to ₹57,490.
  • MacBook Air with M3 chip starting at ₹103,390, discounted to ₹93,390.
  • iPad 10th Gen priced at ₹32,499, further reduced to ₹29,499.
  • Clearance discounts on open-box units starting at ₹32,900 for iPhone 13.
  • Partnerships with major banks offer instant discounts of up to ₹10,000.
“Shoppers who participate in the MyVS loyalty programme can earn points equivalent to 0.75 per cent of their total purchase value.”

In conclusion, the Apple Days Sale provides an excellent opportunity for Apple fans to purchase their favorite products at reduced prices, along with additional bank and loyalty discounts.

item.title: Apple Pulls iPhone 14 and SE from Europe as USB-C Mandate Changes the Game - The Economic Times
item.description:
Apple Pulls iPhone 14 and SE from Europe as USB-C Mandate Changes the Game

Publication Date: December 28, 2024

Source: The Feed

Apple has made a major move by discontinuing sales of the iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus, and iPhone SE (3rd generation) in 29 European countries as part of compliance with a new EU regulation mandating USB-C charging ports for all electronic devices.

  • The decision impacts 29 countries in Europe.
  • The move aims to reduce electronic waste and standardize charging ports.
  • Third-party retailers may still have stock available temporarily.
  • Sales of iPhone SE are declining as a new model is anticipated in Spring 2025.
“Apple has removed these models from its official store, third-party retailers may still sell remaining stocks.”

Apple's shift to USB-C began with the iPhone 15 series, and older models using the Lightning connector have been phased out due to non-compliance with EU regulations.

item.title: Vijay Sales’ Apple Day Sale is back: Massive discount on iPhone 16 Pro, MacBooks, iPads, and more - India TV News
item.description:
Vijay Sales’ Apple Day Sale is back: Massive discount on iPhone 16 Pro, MacBooks, iPads, and more

Publication Date: December 29, 2024

Source: India TV News

Vijay Sales has launched its much-awaited Apple Days Sale, which runs from 29th December 2024 to 5th January 2025. The sale features attractive discounts, exchange offers, and cashback on Apple products, including iPhones, iPads, MacBooks, and more.

  • iPhone 16 series starting at Rs 66,900
  • iPhone 16 Pro available at Rs 1,03,900
  • Previous models discounted: iPhone 15 at Rs 57,490, iPhone 14 at Rs 48,990, iPhone 13 at Rs 42,900
  • MacBook Air M1 starts at Rs 63,890
  • iPad 10th Gen available for Rs 29,499
  • Apple Watch Series 10 starting at Rs 41,099
  • AirPods 4 priced at Rs 11,249
  • Loyalty program offers redeemable points on purchases
“Vijay Sales’ MyVS loyalty program offers 0.75 per cent points on purchases, redeemable later for discounts.”

This sale is a significant opportunity for customers to upgrade their Apple devices at discounted rates.

item.title: XDA's Best of 2024: The greatest tech of the year - XDA Developers
item.description:
XDA's Best of 2024: The Greatest Tech of the Year

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: XDA Developers

This article highlights the best tech products of 2024, from groundbreaking laptops to innovative CPUs. The selection was methodical, ensuring each category has standout products.

  • Best laptop: HP OmniBook Ultra Flip, praised for its superb performance.
  • Worth mentioning: Lenovo Yoga Slim 7x, recognized for its impressive OLED display.
  • Best clamshell laptop: Surface Laptop 7, noted for its versatile design and performance.
  • Best tablet: Surface Pro 11, which now offers an OLED display.
  • Best mobile CPU: Snapdragon X Elite, competing with Intel and AMD.
  • Best desktop CPU: AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D, lauded for its popularity and performance across users.
  • Best GPU: Intel Arc B580, commended for its excellent performance at competitive pricing.
“Literally everyone should buy this” — João Carrasqueira, Lead Windows Editor

In conclusion, 2024 has seen impressive advancements in technology, showcasing products that set benchmarks for performance and design.

item.title: Samsung Unpacked got unmasked while you unwrapped gifts in this week's news - Android Police
item.description:
Samsung Unpacked got unmasked while you unwrapped gifts

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: Android Police

This week in mobile news features significant leaks and announcements surrounding Samsung's upcoming Galaxy Unpacked event scheduled for January 22, where the Galaxy S25 series and possibly the Galaxy Ring will be unveiled. Meanwhile, Google faces regulatory challenges.

  • The next Samsung Unpacked event is on January 22, 2025.
  • Galaxy Ring is expected to have new size options revealed.
  • Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset will enhance AI capabilities on the Galaxy S25.
  • Galaxy S25 could launch in stores on February 7, 2025.
  • Samsung might cut back production of its Z Fold and Z Flip models.
“We have continued to work closely with the Japanese government to demonstrate how we are supporting the Android ecosystem.” - Google spokesperson

The upcoming Galaxy Unpacked event is expected to showcase innovative technologies but also reflects Samsung's strategic shift towards traditional smartphone designs.

item.title: ChatGPT search tool could be open to manipulation using hidden content: Report - CNBCTV18
item.description:
ChatGPT Search Tool Vulnerable to Manipulation, Says Report

Published on: [Date Not Provided] Source: CNBC TV18

The search tool for OpenAI's ChatGPT might be susceptible to manipulation through hidden content, an investigation by The Guardian has revealed.

  • The research found that hidden content can include instructions from third parties that alter AI responses.
  • Techniques like prompt injection can be misused to produce biased outcomes.
  • Example: ChatGPT provided a positive assessment for a product despite negative reviews when prompted by hidden text.
  • There is a ‘high risk’ of deceptive websites being created if the current version is fully released.
“This search functionality has come out (recently) and it’s only available to premium users... They’ve got a very strong (AI security) team there.” - Jacob Larsen, Cybersecurity Researcher

This report raises concerns regarding the integrity of AI-generated responses and highlights the need for robust security measures against manipulation.

item.title: Swipe, match, unswipe: The year we became un-appy with online dating - The Times of India
item.description:
Swipe, match, unswipe: The year we became un-appy with online dating

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Overwhelmed by too many choices, but very few good ones, dating fatigue is on the rise among young Indian singles.

  • Dating fatigue is increasing as users feel overwhelmed by options.
  • Amit tracks his dating app matches and conversations in an Excel sheet.
  • After three months of usage, users like Amit feel exhausted by repetitive conversations and rejection.
  • Dating apps have been around for over a decade in India, providing control over dating choices.
“I realised I was unswiping 76% of my matches,” he says.

This article highlights the challenges and emotional toll that the proliferation of dating apps has taken on users in India.

item.title: Gadgets to help you live, work, play and sleep better in 2025 | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Gadgets to help you live, work, play and sleep better in 2025

Date: Date not specified
Source: Live Mint

This article presents a collection of innovative gadgets designed for 2025 aimed at improving various aspects of daily life, including living, working, playing, and sleeping.

  • Ray-Ban Meta Smart Glasses: Daily companion with AI capabilities for translating languages and more.
  • The Velvetiser: Machine for making velvety hot chocolate.
  • Evie Ring: Smart ring for tracking vital signs and health metrics.
  • Timekettle W4 Pro AI Interpreter Buds: Earbuds for real-time language translation.
  • Kinesis Advantage360: Ergonomic keyboard designed for comfort.
  • Steam Deck OLED: Portable gaming device combining PC and console experiences.
  • Dodow Sleep Aid: A device to help with sleep through breathing synchronization.
“Technology can, at times, jump ahead of tangible experiences.”

This collection showcases gadgets that can significantly enhance everyday activities and wellbeing in the upcoming year.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy Ring 2 set to launch with AI features and IP69 Rating: Details - India TV News
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy Ring 2 Set to Launch with AI Features and IP69 Rating

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: India TV News

Samsung is poised to launch the Galaxy Ring 2, featuring advanced AI capabilities and improved durability. It may debut at the Galaxy Unpacked event on January 22, 2025.

  • Increased size options from nine to eleven for better fit.
  • Enhanced battery life offering up to 7 days on a single charge.
  • Improved durability with an IP69 rating for superior water resistance.
  • AI-driven upgrades making the smart ring more intuitive and versatile.
“With its AI-driven upgrades, wider size options, improved battery life, and IP69 rating, the Galaxy Ring 2 promises to redefine smart wearables.”

The Galaxy Ring 2 is highly anticipated, following Samsung's successful history with smart wearables, potentially setting new standards in the market.

item.title: OnePlus Open 2 alleged leaks suggest upgraded design, IPX8 rating, and Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC | Mint - Mint
item.description:
OnePlus Open 2 alleged leaks suggest upgraded design, IPX8 rating, and Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: Live Mint

Tech giant OnePlus is reportedly gearing up to launch the OnePlus Open 2, a successor to its 2023 foldable model, scheduled for early next year. Leaks suggest significant upgrades in design and specifications.

  • Refined design featuring a larger circular camera module with a rearranged triple-camera setup.
  • IPX8 water resistance rating, an improvement over the IPX4 rating of its predecessor.
  • Powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, with options for up to 16GB RAM and 1TB storage.
  • Display specs include an 8-inch LTPO main screen with 2K resolution and 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Expected camera capabilities: triple 50MP rear sensors and dual selfie cameras (32MP and 20MP).
  • 5,900mAh battery with 80W wired fast charging support.

As OnePlus prepares for the global launch of its flagship OnePlus 13 on January 7, 2025, the OnePlus 12 has also seen a price reduction, making it an attractive option for buyers seeking a premium smartphone at a lower cost.

item.title: OnePlus Pad launched with a power bank-like battery: Details here - India TV News
item.description:
OnePlus Pad launched with a power bank-like battery: Details here

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: India TV News

OnePlus has officially launched its latest tablet, the OnePlus Pad, primarily targeting the Chinese market. The tablet, which is a rebranded version of the Oppo Pad 3, offers a variety of impressive features including a large battery and sleek display.

Key Points:

  • Available storage variants include:
    • 8GB + 128GB: 2099 yuan (approx. Rs 24,000)
    • 8GB + 256GB: 2399 yuan (approx. Rs 28,000)
    • 12GB + 256GB: 2699 yuan (approx. Rs 31,000)
    • 12GB + 512GB: 3099 yuan (approx. Rs 36,000)
  • Display features:
    • 11.61-inch 2.8K resolution IPS LCD panel
    • 144Hz refresh rate
    • Peak brightness of 700 nits
  • Performance powered by:
    • MediaTek Dimensity 8350 chipset
    • Android 15 operating system
  • Camera setup includes:
    • 8-megapixel rear camera
    • 8-megapixel front camera
  • Battery specifications:
    • 9520 mAh battery
    • 67W SuperVOOC fast charging
The OnePlus Pad features powerful performance, a vibrant display, and long-lasting battery life, making it a strong contender in the tablet market.

This launch indicates OnePlus's intention to expand its tablet portfolio globally after initially focusing on the domestic market.

item.title: iPhone 17 Pro details leak: Everything we know - India Today
item.description:
iPhone 17 Pro Details Leak: What We Know So Far

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: India Today

Recent leaks provide insights into the anticipated designs and features of the iPhone 17 Pro series, potentially signaling significant changes.

  • The camera design is rumored to resemble that of the Google Pixel 9 series.
  • There are suggestions that the iPhone 17 Pro may maintain a traditional design rather than adopting a new look.
  • Apple is expected to revert from a titanium frame back to aluminum.
  • A dual-tone rear panel is anticipated for the iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max.
  • Metalens camera technology could be introduced, allowing for a smaller Dynamic Island cutout.
  • The newer models may feature thinner bezels for an improved screen design.
  • The 5x Telephoto optical zoom lens will remain a Pro-exclusive feature.
  • Easier battery removal is anticipated, following technology introduced in the iPhone 16 series.
  • The iPhone 17 Air is also expected to launch with an upgraded chipset and a lower price point.
"The iPhone 17 Air is expected to cost just like the Plus variants and lower than the Pro models." - India Today

The iPhone 17 Pro series is shaping up to be an exciting release, with various rumors hinting at meaningful design and functional enhancements.

item.title: Tipsters Leak OnePlus Open 2 Alleged Renders, Slimmer Design Expected - ABP Live
item.description:
Tipsters Leak OnePlus Open 2 Alleged Renders, Slimmer Design Expected

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 Source: Smartprix

The upcoming OnePlus Open 2 is set to debut early next year, featuring a slimmer profile and upgraded specifications compared to its predecessor.

  • Expected to use the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.
  • Leaked renders show a larger camera module with a new design layout.
  • Rumored to have an IPX8 water resistance rating.
  • Display expected to be 8-inch LTPO with a 2K resolution.
  • Triple rear camera setup: 50 MP + 50 MP + 50 MP for various photography needs.
  • Expected to have a battery capacity of 5,900 mAh.
"OnePlus Open 2. Larger yet thinner than the OnePlus Open (sub-10 mm folded). IPX8 rating (vs. IPX4 on the Open)." — Noah Cat

This smartphone is anticipated to compete closely with the upcoming Oppo Find N5, expected to launch shortly after.

item.title: YouTube Play Something feature is being tested on smartphone app - Techlusive
item.description:
YouTube Tests 'Play Something' Feature on Smartphone App

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Techlusive

YouTube is testing a new feature called 'Play Something' for its smartphone application, allowing users to play suggested videos based on their preferences.

YouTube Play Something Button Appears

  • The 'Play Something' button will replace the minimized video player when opening the app.
  • Upon tapping the button, a video is selected based on user preferences.
  • The video player will resemble YouTube Shorts and will play regular videos in portrait orientation.
  • If the minimized player is active, the 'Play Something' button will be inaccessible.
  • YouTube is also testing AI tools to allow creators to 'restyle' licensed audio tracks for Shorts.

This feature is part of YouTube’s innovation to enhance user experience and engage viewers more effectively.

item.title: Tech that listens, talks back: Kashyap Kompella lists his top finds of 2024 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prompt assistants, smart glasses, an app to decode the night sky — it’s been a tricky year to balance digital abundance with security and privacy, but here’s the tech year wrapped.

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the top tech finds of 2024, highlighting key innovations in apps and gadgets.

  • MacWhisper: A reliable transcription tool built on OpenAI’s Whisper model.
  • PromptPerfect: A tool that transforms simple sentences into detailed prompts for AI assistants.
  • NotebookLM: Generates audio summaries from large documents, enhancing AI interaction.
  • Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses: Look innocent but can take photos and videos.
  • Quick-commerce apps are becoming more common but can be inefficient.
  • Three small innovations that improve daily life: a silent haptic alarm, School of Life app, and Sky Guide app.
“I cannot adequately express the joy of waking up to a vibrating alert on my wrist that has disturbed no one else.”

The article captures Kashyap Kompella's insights on innovative tech tools and their impact on privacy and convenience.

item.title: YouTube’s new ‘Play Something’ button could help put a stop to your endless scrolling woes - The Indian Express
item.description:
YouTube experimenting with new ‘Play Something’ button: Here’s what it does

Date: December 2024 Source: Indian Express

YouTube is testing a new “Play something” button aimed at improving user experience by helping viewers find videos more easily. This button plays a random video in the Shorts player or traditional content in portrait mode.

  • The button features a black background with white text.
  • Tapping it begins playback of random videos in the Shorts format.
  • The button disappears when the mini-player is active.
  • This is not the first attempt; earlier versions were noticed in 2023.
  • The rollout of the button is still uncertain.
“Can’t decide what to watch?” – Previous message associated with the Play something button.

The new button aims to enhance user engagement by reducing the time spent scrolling for content.

item.title: Leak: One UI 7 Beta 3 gets animation upgrades, new sound effects - Sammy Fans
item.description:
One UI 7 Beta 3: Enhancements in Animations and Sound Effects for Galaxy S24

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Sammy Fans

The upcoming One UI 7 Beta 3 update for the Galaxy S24 series is set to improve user experience with upgraded sound effects and smoother animations.

  • The update will introduce new sound effects for unlocking, locking, and charging the device.
  • Drop-down animations will be enhanced for better fluidity.
  • These changes aim to elevate the overall interaction experience with Galaxy devices.
  • Samsung may limit the beta program to Galaxy S24 series devices, excluding older models.
“These changes will likely make your phone feel even better to use.”

Although not officially confirmed by Samsung, these improvements are highly anticipated by Galaxy S24 users looking forward to the beta release.
